snippet: A Westchester County grand jury voted not to indict a White Plains police officer who fatally shot a man who had mistakenly alerted an emergency system for medical help.
abstract: Westchester County grand jury votes not to indict White Plains Police Officer Anthony Carelli, who fatally shot former correction officer and Marine Kenneth Chamberlain Sr in his apartment in November 2011; jury calls the shooting of Chamberlain, who had mistakenly alerted an emergency system for medical help, tragic but finds no reasonable cause for an indictment.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: A Westchester County grand jury voted not to indict a White Plains police officer who fatally shot a man who had mistakenly alerted an emergency system for medical help.

headline.seo: No Charges for Officer Who Killed Man, 68, in Westchester County
headline.main: No Charges for Officer in Killing of Man, 68
headline.print_headline: No Charges For Officer In the Killing Of a Man, 68
